H0.text: Pyruvate is the end product of glycolysis.

H1.text: Fructose is the end product of glycolysis.

H2.text: Gluclose is the end product of glycolysis.

H3.text: Hydrolysis is the end product of glycolysis.

A4.text: The glycolytic end-product, pyruvate (plus NAD+) is converted to acetyl-CoA, CO2 and NADH + H+ within the mitochondria in a process called pyruvate decarboxylation.

A5.text: Glycolysis is the metabolic pathway that converts glucose (C6H12O6) into pyruvate and, in most organisms, occurs in the liquid part of cells (the cytosol).
